items.title: Sarah McGregor
items.subtitle: Maid of Honour
items.bio: The Jake to my Elwood. We’ve been sisters for 21 years and I blooming love her to bits. Sarah has been giving me dependable romance advice since she was twelve, so when she described Luke and me as her ‘OTP’ (youth-speak for a perfect couple) I figured it was safe to marry him.

items.title: Emma Saxon
items.subtitle: Bridesmaid
items.bio: The Ann Perkins to my Leslie Knope. I met Emma at university in 2010, and after bonding over a love of cupcakes and Disney movies, we became fast friends. She’s one of the kindest, most level-headed people I know. She’s keeping me sane through all the wedding organisation, and even baking our cake!

items.title: Sara Karimi
items.subtitle: Bridesmaid
items.bio: The Carter to my Lee. I’ve known Saz since we were six years old, and we’ve been through thick and thin together. Despite being rather different people, we were always the perfect partners in mischief! I can always rely on Saz for honesty, friendship and rude jokes.

items.title: Jess (Yang Li)
items.subtitle: Bridesmaid
items.bio: The GD to my Top. I met Jess at university in 2010. She has an infectious laugh and I remember us giggling like kids while trying to study in the library. After Jess spent Christmas with my family, my parents all but adopted her. Although she returned to China in 2013, we’ve stayed good friends and I’m honoured that she’s flying over for the wedding.

items.title: Frank Hamand
items.subtitle: Best man
items.bio: I’ve known Frank since the beginning of secondary school; we both belonged to the ‘train crew” at Latymer. He secured the place of best man due to his steadfast friendship and winning dance moves. He was pretty handy in helping me with this website too!

items.title: Jacob Bigio
items.subtitle: Groomsman
items.bio: Jacob once (unintentionally) flipped me over a table for a screwdriver. We’re still friends though. These days he’s usually hitchhiking around the world; although he’s always missed, when he returns it’s as if he never left, which I take as a sign of real friendship. I’m really chuffed that he’ll be taking a break in his exploration of South America to come to the wedding.

items.title: Philip Woollett
items.subtitle: Groomsman
items.bio: As my brother, Philip has known me since I was two years old. He saw me through all my phases (such as living in a baseball cap), though I’m hoping he won’t entertain wedding guests with stories of my teenage years. As we’ve grown up we’ve become closer and closer; I couldn’t ask for a better brother.

items.title: Thomas Eagle
items.subtitle: Groomsman
items.bio: Thom and I have been friends for many years, minus the hours we spent playing Munchkin (a poisonous board game - never pay it with people you like). Thom is a steadfast friend; he’s always there if you need him. He’s even offered to pay for the marquee if it burns down (please ask him about this).

items.title: Ilia Popovski
items.subtitle: Groomsman
items.bio: Ilia and I initially bonded in Economics class over our mutual love of Adam Smith. He beat me to the altar with his wonderful wife Yumi, whom he married in April, but it does mean he’s adept at handling wedding matters! He also he brings a calm, serene demeanour to the groomsmen group (sorely needed, what with the other lot).

items.title: Ishaac Awatli
items.subtitle: Groomsman
items.bio: Ishaac once said I was one of the coolest people he knew. He found cooler people since, but he’s been kind enough to stay my friend. A true friend, he holds the esteemed position of the only person from home to visit me at university - and it was one of the best nights I had there. Doubtless he’ll get everyone on the dancefloor at the wedding too.
